summary: The Business Owners Protection Act of 2025 aims to terminate unused authorities of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) that were granted by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act. Specifically, it targets authorities that provide discretion for creating requirements for private entities and for which the SEC did not issue proposed rules by January 1, 2025. The bill mandates the SEC to create a publicly available list of terminated authorities within 180 days of the bill's enactment.
